tasks.task: Conducting field trials for verifying furrow irrigation design parameters
subtasks: Select a representative segment of the field for observation
Choose a range of stream sizes (e.g., Q_max, maximum allowable, and slightly higher values)
Measure the elapsed time (e.g., water front movement) for each stream size
Plot the elapsed time vs. distance for each stream size
Identify the maximum allowable stream size (non-erosive) and compare with Q_max
Use iterative procedures to adjust field length and advance time based on observations
Evaluate distribution pattern efficiency (FAR) and distribution pattern efficiency (ED)
Calculate net depth of infiltration (TN) and time of advance (Tt)
Determine unit stream size (Q divided by furrow width)
Assess cutoff time (TCO) and ensure advance time is within the cutoff period
Calculate the maximum depth of flow (D_max) and ridge height requirements
Determine the appropriate basin size based on soil type using thumb rules or design formulas
Use Manning's equation to calculate net time of infiltration (TN)
Evaluate distribution pattern efficiency (FAR) and its relation to fractional advance ratio (ED)
Calculate time of advance (Tt) and fractional advance ratio (FAR)
Adjust basin length and net depth of infiltration based on desired distribution pattern efficiency
Determine maximum depth of flow (D_max) and ridge height (approx. 1.25 x D_max)
Consider cutoff time (TCO) and ensure proper water management practices
